description: This notification is generated when the round trip time
(jnxPingCtlRttThreshold) exceeds the configured
threshold (jnxPingCtlRttThreshold) and the rttThreshold bit is
set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Round trip time exceeded the threshold $v13

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingRttThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttThreshold u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsRttUs u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

description: Specifies the host address to be used at a remote host for
performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs

description: The maximum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs

description: The average of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: This object contains the sum of the squares for all ping
responses received. Its purpose is to enable standard
deviation calculation. The value of this object MUST
be reported as 0 when no ping responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: Maximum round trip time allowed. If this threshold is crossed
by any probe, a jnxPingRttThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttThreshold

description: The round trip delays measured for the most recent successful probe
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsRttUs

description: This notification is generated when the standard deviation of
the round trip time (jnxPingResultsStdDevRttUs) exceeds the
configured threshold (jnxPingCtlRttStdDevThreshold) and the
rttStdDevThreshold bit is set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Standard deviation of round trip time exceeded the threshold $v13

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingRttStdDevThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttStdDevThreshold u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStdDevRttUs u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

object.

with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs

description: The maximum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs

description: The average of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: This object contains the sum of the squares for all ping
responses received. Its purpose is to enable standard
deviation calculation. The value of this object MUST
be reported as 0 when no ping responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: The maximum round trip time standard deviation allowed over the
course of any test. If the calculated standard deviation of the
round trip time at the end of any test exceeds this threshold
a jnxPingRttStdDevThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttStdDevThreshold

description: The standard deviation of the round trip delays measured
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStdDevRttUs

description: This notification is generated when the round trip time jitter
(jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs minus jnxPingResultsMinRttUs) exceeds the
configured threshold (jnxPingCtlRttJitterThreshold) and the
rttJitterThreshold bit is set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Round trip time jitter exceeded the threshold $v13

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingRttJitterThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttJitterThreshold u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

description: Specifies the host address to be used at a remote host for
performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string

specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs

description: The maximum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs

description: The average of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: This object contains the sum of the squares for all ping
responses received. Its purpose is to enable standard
deviation calculation. The value of this object MUST
be reported as 0 when no ping responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: The maximum allowed jitter in the round trip time over the course
of any test. Jitter is defined as the difference between the
maximum and minimum round trip times measured over the course of
a single test (jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs minus jnxPingResultsMinRttUs).
If the measured jitter exceeds this threshold, a
jnxPingRttJitterThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttJitterThreshold

description: This notification is generated when the egress time
(jnxPingResultsEgressUs) exceeds the configured
threshold (jnxPingCtlEgressTimeThreshold) and the
egressThreshold bit is set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Ping egress time exceeded the threshold $v12

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingEgressThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinEgressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxEgressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgEgressUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlEgressTimeThreshold u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsEgressUs u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

description: Specifies the host address to be used at a remote host for
performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the egress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinEgressUs

description: The maximum of the egress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxEgressUs

description: The average of the egress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgEgressUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: Maximum egress trip time allowed. If this threshold is crossed by
any probe, a jnxPingEgressThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType) provides one way
delay measurements. Currently jnxPingIcmpTimeStamp is the only
supported probe type with this property.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlEgressTimeThreshold

description: The egress trip delays measured for the most recent successful probe
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsEgressUs

description: This notification is generated when the standard deviation of
the egress time (jnxPingResultsStddevEgressUs) exceeds the
configured threshold (jnxPingCtlEgressStdDevThreshold) and the
egressStdDevThreshold bit is set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Standard deviation of ping egress time exceeded the threshold $v13

description: The standard deviation of the egress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStddevEgressUs

description: This notification is generated when the egress time jitter
(jnxPingResultsMaxEgressUs minus jnxPingResultsMinEgressUs)

event.Summary: Ping egress time jitter exceeded the threshold $v12

variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: The maximum allowed jitter in the egress trip time over the course
of any test. Jitter is defined as the difference between the
maximum and minimum egress trip times measured over the course of
a single test (jnxPingResultsMaxSrcDstt minus jnxPingResultsMinSrcDstt).
If the measured jitter exceeds this threshold, a
jnxPingEgressJitterThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType) provides one way
delay measurements. Currently jnxPingIcmpTimeStamp is the only
supported probe type with this property.

description: This notification is generated when the ingress time
(jnxPingResultsIngressUs) exceeds the configured
threshold (jnxPingCtlIngressTimeThreshold) and the
ingressThreshold bit is set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Ping ingress time exceeded the threshold $v12

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingIngressThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgIngressUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlIngressTimeThreshold u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsIngressUs u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

description: Specifies the host address to be used at a remote host for
performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the ingress trip delays measured for over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs

description: The maximum of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs

description: The average of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgIngressUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: Maximum ingress trip time allowed. If this threshold is crossed by
any probe, a jnxPingIngressThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType) provides one way
delay measurements. Currently jnxPingIcmpTimeStamp is the only
supported probe type with this property.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlIngressTimeThreshold

description: The ingress trip delays measured for the most recent successful probe
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsIngressUs

description: This notification is generated when the standard deviation of
the ingress time (jnxPingResultsStddevIngressUs) exceeds the
configured threshold (jnxPingCtlIngressStddevThreshold) and the
ingressStdDevThreshold bit is set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Standard deviation of ping ingress time exceeded the threshold $v13

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingIngressStddevThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgIngressUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStddevIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlIngressStddevThreshold u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStddevIngressUs u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the ingress trip delays measured for over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs

description: The maximum of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs

description: The average of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgIngressUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: The standard deviation of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStddevIngressUs

description: The maximum ingress trip time standard deviation allowed over the
course of any test. If the calculated standard deviation of the
ingress trip time at the end of any test exceeds this threshold
a jnxPingIngressStddevThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType) provides one way
delay measurements. Currently jnxPingIcmpTimeStamp is the only
supported probe type with this property.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlIngressStddevThreshold

description: The standard deviation of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsStddevIngressUs

description: This notification is generated when the ingress time jitter
(jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs minus jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs)
exceeds the configured threshold (jnxPingCtlIngressJitterThreshold)
and the ingressJitterThreshold bit is set in
jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Ping ingress time jitter exceeded the threshold $v12

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingIngressJitterThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgIngressUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlIngressJitterThreshold u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

description: Specifies the host address to be used at a remote host for
performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the ingress trip delays measured for over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinIngressUs

description: The maximum of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxIngressUs

description: The average of the ingress trip delays measured over all
probes during this test. Measured in microseconds.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType)
provides one-way delay measurements. For all other probe types,
their values are irrelevant and will return 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgIngressUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: The maximum allowed jitter in the ingress trip time over the course
of any test. Jitter is defined as the difference between the
maximum and minimum ingress trip times measured over the course of
a single test (jnxPingResultsMaxDstSrct minus jnxPingResultsMinDstSrct).
If the measured jitter exceeds this threshold, a
jnxPingIngressJitterThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
This applies only if the probe type (pingCtlType) provides one way
delay measurements. Currently jnxPingIcmpTimeStamp is the only
supported probe type with this property.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlIngressJitterThreshold

description: This notification is generated when the max round trip time
(jnxPingCtlMaxRttThreshold) exceeds the configured
threshold (jnxPingCtlMaxRttThreshold) and the maxrttThreshold bit is
set in jnxPingCtlTrapGeneration.

event.Summary: Max round trip time exceeded the threshold $v13

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingMaxRttThresholdExceeded DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress s EXAMPLE DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus i 1 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType i 0 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares u 9999 DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttThreshold u 9999 JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsRttUs u 9999

description: Specifies the type of host address to be used at a remote
host for performing a ping operation.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddressType

description: Specifies the host address to be used at a remote host for
performing a ping operation. The host address type is
determined by the object value of corresponding
pingCtlTargetAddressType.
A value for this object MUST be set prior to transitioning
its corresponding pingCtlEntry to active(1) via
pingCtlRowStatus.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingCtlTargetAddress

description: Reflects the operational state of a pingCtlEntry:
enabled(1) - Test is active.
disabled(2) - Test has stopped.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsOperStatus

description: This objects indicates the type of address stored
in the corresponding pingResultsIpTargetAddress
object.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddressType

description: This objects reports the IP address associated
with a pingCtlTargetAddress value when the destination
address is specified as a DNS name. The value of
this object should be a zero length octet string
when a DNS name is not specified or when a
specified DNS name fails to resolve.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsIpTargetAddress

description: The minimum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMinRttUs

description: The maximum of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsMaxRttUs

description: The average of the round trip delays measured for all the probes
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsAvgRttUs

description: Number of responses received for the corresponding
pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry. The value of this object
MUST be reported as 0 when no probe responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsProbeResponses

description: The value of this object reflects the number of probes sent
for the corresponding pingCtlEntry and pingResultsEntry.
The value of this object MUST be reported as 0 when no probes
have been sent.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsSentProbes

description: This object contains the sum of the squares for all ping
responses received. Its purpose is to enable standard
deviation calculation. The value of this object MUST
be reported as 0 when no ping responses have been
received.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsRttSumOfSquares

description: Date and time when the last response was received for
a probe.
variables.name: DISMAN-PING-MIB::pingResultsLastGoodProbe

description: Maximum round trip time allowed. If this threshold is crossed
by any probe, a jnxPingRttThresholdExceeded trap will be sent.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingCtlRttThreshold

description: The round trip delays measured for the most recent successful probe
during this test. Measured in microseconds.
variables.name: JUNIPER-PING-MIB::jnxPingResultsRttUs
